title: Kaldi's Coffee

parameters.grind_size: Medium-fine, aiming for a grind that allows for a long, steady pour with a slight pool of water on top.

preparation_steps: Grind 16 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.
Place filter in V60 and rinse with 50-100mL of hot water to pre-heat and remove paper taste. Discard rinse water.
Add 16 grams of ground coffee, gently shake to level, and create a deep divot in the center.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bloom: Pour 40mL of water (2.5x coffee weight) into the divot, then move circularly to the outside grounds. Swirl the brewer immediately to distribute water, then stir through the bed (e.g., zig-zags) to break up dry pockets.
Main Pour: Pour aggressively, full tilt, directly into the middle, then swirl out to the edge. Aim for 75mL in this stage, reaching 115mL total. This breaks channels and raises slurry temperature.
Stop pouring and give a gentle swirl to flatten the bed.
Final Pour: Begin pouring very gently in the center, maintaining the water level with small circles, until 256mL is reached. The water above the coffee may become clear.
Give one more slight swirl to flatten the bed for drain down.

notes: Total Brew Time: 2:45 to 3:30.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bloom: Pour 80mL of water (2.5x coffee weight) into the divot, then move circularly to the outside grounds. Swirl the brewer immediately to distribute water, then stir through the bed (e.g., zig-zags) to break up dry pockets.
Main Pour: Pour aggressively, full tilt, directly into the middle, then swirl out to the edge. Aim for 150mL in this stage, reaching 230mL total. This breaks channels and raises slurry temperature.
Stop pouring and give a gentle swirl to flatten the bed.
Final Pour: Begin pouring very gently in the center, maintaining the water level with small circles, until 512mL is reached. The water above the coffee may become clear.
Give one more slight swirl to flatten the bed for drain down.

notes: Total Brew Time: 3:00 to 3:45. Perfect for 2 people.

Main Pour: Pour aggressively, full tilt, directly into the middle, then swirl out to the edge. Aim for 300mL in this stage, reaching 460mL total. This breaks channels and raises slurry temperature.

title: James Hoffmann V60

parameters.grind_size: Medium-fine for lighter roasted coffees; coarser for darker roasts. Ultimately, grind size is dialed in by taste, aiming for the finest possible grind before bitterness emerges.

preparation_steps: Grind 30 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.
Fold filter paper along seam and fit to V60.
Pre-heat with hot water and discard.
Add coffee to V60 and make a small well/divot in the center of the bed.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bloom (0:00): Start timer. Pour 60 grams of water (2x coffee dose) to saturate the grounds.
Swirl (0:10): Gently swirl the brewer until the coffee slurry is even.
Bloom continues (0:20): Let the coffee bloom until 0:45. This bloom period allows for de-gassing, which is crucial for fresh coffee.
First Main Pour (0:45 - 1:15): Pour up to 300 grams of water (60% of total brew water) within 30 seconds. This pour keeps the V60 topped up.
Second Main Pour (1:15 - 1:45): Gently pour up to 500 grams of water (100% of total brew water) within 30 seconds.

Stir (1:45): Stir gently clockwise and then anticlockwise (about 1 to 1.5 revolutions each way) to dislodge grounds from the sides. This step helps ensure all coffee particles are engaged in extraction.
Swirl (1:55): Gently swirl the brewer to flatten the coffee bed for even extraction. A flat bed is preferred for consistent drawdown.

notes: Water Temperature: 95°C general, 100°C for high-quality light roasts, 90–95°C or 80–90°C for darker roasts. Aim to finish drawdown by 3 minutes 30 seconds. Total brew time can vary, but focus on a complete, even drain.

title: James Hoffmann V60

parameters.grind_size: Medium-fine, slightly coarser than single serving to prevent over-extraction.

Second Main Pour (1:20 - 1:50): Gently pour up to 1000 grams of water (100% of total brew water) within 30 seconds.

Stir (1:50): Stir gently clockwise and then anticlockwise (about 1 to 1.5 revolutions each way) to dislodge grounds from the sides. This step helps ensure all coffee particles are engaged in extraction.
Swirl (2:00): Gently swirl the brewer to flatten the coffee bed for even extraction. A flat bed is preferred for consistent drawdown.

notes: Water Temperature: 95°C general, 100°C for high-quality light roasts, 90–95°C or 80–90°C for darker roasts. Aim to finish drawdown by 4 minutes. Perfect for 2 people.

title: Tetsu Kasuya 4:6 Method
preparation_steps: Grind 20 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 50g water (40% of total), stir gently.
Pour 70g water (60% of remaining), gentle swirl.
Pour 60g water, gentle swirl.
Pour 60g water, gentle swirl.
Final pour of 60g water, gentle swirl.
Let drain completely.

notes: The 4:6 method focuses on controlling sweetness and acidity through pour timing.

title: Tetsu Kasuya 4:6 Method
preparation_steps: Grind 40 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 100g water (40% of total), stir gently.
Pour 140g water (60% of remaining), gentle swirl.
Pour 120g water, gentle swirl.
Pour 120g water, gentle swirl.
Final pour of 120g water, gentle swirl.
Let drain completely.

notes: The 4:6 method focuses on controlling sweetness and acidity through pour timing. Perfect for 2 people.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 150g water (40% of total), stir gently.
Pour 210g water (60% of remaining), gentle swirl.
Pour 180g water, gentle swirl.
Pour 180g water, gentle swirl.
Final pour of 180g water, gentle swirl.
Let drain completely.

notes: The 4:6 method focuses on controlling sweetness and acidity through pour timing. Perfect for 3 people.

notes: The 4:6 method focuses on controlling sweetness and acidity through pour timing. Perfect for 4 people.

title: Scott Rao V60
preparation_steps: Grind 18 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 54g water (3x coffee weight), stir gently.
Pour to 150g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Pour to 225g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Pour to 300g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Let drain completely.

notes: Focus on maintaining consistent pour rate and minimal agitation.

title: Scott Rao V60
preparation_steps: Grind 36 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 108g water (3x coffee weight), stir gently.
Pour to 300g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Pour to 450g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Pour to 600g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Let drain completely.

notes: Focus on maintaining consistent pour rate and minimal agitation. Perfect for 2 people.

title: Scott Rao V60
preparation_steps: Grind 54 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 162g water (3x coffee weight), stir gently.
Pour to 450g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Pour to 675g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Pour to 900g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Let drain completely.

notes: Focus on maintaining consistent pour rate and minimal agitation. Perfect for 3 people.

title: Scott Rao V60
preparation_steps: Grind 72 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 216g water (3x coffee weight), stir gently.
Pour to 600g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Pour to 900g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.
Pour to 1200g in 15 seconds, gentle swirl.

notes: Focus on maintaining consistent pour rate and minimal agitation. Perfect for 4 people.

title: Quick Morning V60
preparation_steps: Grind 12 grams of coffee to medium consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 36g water, stir gently.
Pour remaining water in 2-3 pours.
Let drain.

notes: Perfect for busy mornings when you need coffee quickly.

title: Competition Style V60
preparation_steps: Grind 15 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 45g water, stir in figure-8 pattern.
Pour to 100g in 10 seconds, gentle swirl.
Pour to 150g in 10 seconds, gentle swirl.
Pour to 200g in 10 seconds, gentle swirl.
Final pour to 250g, gentle swirl.
Let drain completely.

notes: Competition-style brewing focuses on precision and consistency.

title: Classic Chemex
preparation_steps: Grind 30 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 60g water for bloom, stir gently
Pour to 200g in slow, steady stream
Wait 30 seconds
Pour to 350g
Wait 30 seconds
Final pour to 500g
Let drain completely

notes: Chemex produces a clean, bright cup with low body.

title: Chemex Single Cup
preparation_steps: Grind 15 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 30g water for bloom, stir gently
Pour to 100g in slow, steady stream
Wait 30 seconds
Pour to 175g
Wait 30 seconds
Final pour to 250g
Let drain completely

notes: Perfect single-serve Chemex brewing method.

title: French Press Classic
preparation_steps: Grind 30 grams of coffee to coarse consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 500g hot water
Stir gently to saturate grounds
Place lid on top (don't press yet)
Press plunger down slowly
Pour immediately

notes: Simple and forgiving method, produces full-bodied coffee.

title: French Press Single Cup
preparation_steps: Grind 15 grams of coffee to coarse consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 250g hot water
Stir gently to saturate grounds
Place lid on top (don't press yet)
Press plunger down slowly
Pour immediately

notes: Perfect for single-serve French Press brewing.

title: AeroPress Standard
preparation_steps: Grind 17 grams of coffee to fine consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 250g hot water
Stir for 10 seconds
Insert plunger and pull up slightly
Wait 1 minute
Press down slowly over 30 seconds

notes: Versatile method that can produce both espresso-like and filter coffee.

title: AeroPress Inverted
preparation_steps: Grind 18 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 250g hot water
Stir for 10 seconds
Wait 1 minute
Screw on cap with filter
Flip and press down slowly over 30 seconds

notes: Inverted method prevents premature dripping and allows longer steeping.

title: V60 Family Brew
preparation_steps: Grind 45 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency
Use V60 03 size for larger capacity

brewing_steps.instruction: Bloom: Pour 90g water (2x coffee weight), stir gently in circular motion
First pour: Add 180g water in slow, steady spiral, reaching 270g total
Wait 30 seconds for extraction
Second pour: Add 225g water, reaching 495g total
Wait 30 seconds
Final pour: Add remaining 225g water to reach 720g total
Let drain completely, should finish around 4:30-5:00

notes: Perfect for serving 3-4 people. Use coarser grind to prevent over-extraction with larger dose.

title: Chemex Party Brew
preparation_steps: Grind 60 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency

brewing_steps.instruction: Bloom: Pour 120g water (2x coffee weight), stir gently
First pour: Add 300g water in slow, steady stream, reaching 420g total
Wait 45 seconds for extraction
Second pour: Add 300g water, reaching 720g total
Wait 45 seconds
Final pour: Add remaining 280g water to reach 1000g total
Let drain completely, should finish around 6:00-6:30

notes: Perfect for serving 4 people. Chemex produces clean, bright coffee that's great for sharing.

title: French Press Gathering
preparation_steps: Grind 60 grams of coffee to coarse consistency

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 1000g hot water over grounds
Stir gently to saturate all grounds
Place lid on top (don't press yet)
Wait 4 minutes for extraction
Press plunger down slowly and steadily
Pour immediately to prevent over-extraction

notes: Perfect for serving 4 people. Simple and forgiving method that produces full-bodied coffee.

title: V60 Duo Brew
preparation_steps: Grind 32 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.
Place filter in V60 and rinse with 50-100mL of hot water to pre-heat and remove paper taste. Discard rinse water.
Add 32 grams of ground coffee to the filter and level the bed.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bloom: Pour 64 grams of water (2x coffee dose), stir gently
First pour: Add 128g water in slow, steady stream
Wait 30 seconds for extraction
Second pour: Add 128g water
Wait 30 seconds
Final pour: Add remaining 192g water to reach 512g total
Let drain completely, should finish around 4:00

notes: Perfect for 2 people. Balanced extraction with good clarity and body.

title: AeroPress Duo
preparation_steps: Grind 36 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 500g hot water
Stir gently for 10 seconds
Wait 60 seconds
Attach filter and cap
Flip and press slowly over 30 seconds

notes: Great for 2 people. Rich, full-bodied coffee with low acidity.

title: George Stanica's Championship AeroPress
preparation_steps: Grind 18 grams of specialty coffee to medium-coarse consistency.
Set up your AeroPress inverted and insert plunger to create a seal at the 4th mark.
Prepare and rinse a single Aesir paper filter in the cap using hot water.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add ground coffee to the inverted AeroPress.
Bloom: Pour 50g of water over grounds using a gentle, controlled pour. Ensure all grounds are saturated.
Second Pour: Add 50g more water over 5–6 seconds, pouring evenly to maintain saturation.
Stir in a North-South-East-West pattern for 10 seconds to ensure uniform extraction.
Attach filter cap. Gently remove any excess air by pulling slightly on the plunger for 10 seconds.
Carefully flip the AeroPress onto a sturdy vessel.
Press gently and steadily for 30–40 seconds, aiming to extract 76–79g of concentrate.
Add enough hot water to the extracted concentrate to reach 130–135g.
Balance flavor by adding 20–30g of room temperature water and stir.

notes: Championship recipe using inverted method. Precise temperature and grind size control are crucial for clean cup and clarity.

title: George Stanica's Championship AeroPress
preparation_steps: Grind 36 grams of specialty coffee to medium-coarse consistency.

Add enough hot water to the extracted concentrate to reach 260–270g.
Balance flavor by adding 40–60g of room temperature water and stir.

notes: Championship recipe using inverted method. Perfect for 2 people. Precise temperature and grind size control are crucial for clean cup and clarity.

title: George Stanica's Championship AeroPress
preparation_steps: Grind 72 grams of specialty coffee to medium-coarse consistency.
Set up your AeroPress inverted and insert plunger to create a seal at the 4th mark.

notes: Championship recipe using inverted method. Perfect for 4 people. Precise temperature and grind size control are crucial for clean cup and clarity.

title: James Hoffmann's Ultimate AeroPress
preparation_steps: Prepare AeroPress in standard orientation with paper filter (no need to preheat).

brewing_steps.instruction: Add ground coffee to the AeroPress.
Add 200g boiling water quickly to fully saturate grounds.
Insert plunger 1cm to create vacuum seal.
Swirl gently to break crust on surface.
Press slowly until finished.

notes: This recipe creates a lighter-bodied cup despite fine grind due to high water ratio. No stirring before pressing preserves clarity.

title: James Hoffmann's Ultimate AeroPress
preparation_steps: Prepare AeroPress in standard orientation with paper filter (no need to preheat).

brewing_steps.instruction: Add ground coffee to the AeroPress.
Add 400g boiling water quickly to fully saturate grounds.
Insert plunger 1cm to create vacuum seal.
Swirl gently to break crust on surface.

notes: This recipe creates a lighter-bodied cup despite fine grind due to high water ratio. Perfect for 2 people. No stirring before pressing preserves clarity.

notes: This recipe creates a lighter-bodied cup despite fine grind due to high water ratio. Perfect for 4 people. No stirring before pressing preserves clarity.

title: Tim Wendelboe Classic AeroPress
preparation_steps: Prepare AeroPress in standard position with rinsed paper filter.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add coffee grounds to AeroPress.
Pour 200g hot water over coffee, ensuring full saturation.
Stir 3 times gently.
Insert plunger and pull slightly up to create vacuum.
Stir 3 times again.
Press slowly all the way through.

notes: Balanced and forgiving recipe suitable for most coffees. Vacuum step prevents early dripping.

title: Tim Wendelboe Classic AeroPress
preparation_steps: Prepare AeroPress in standard position with rinsed paper filter.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add coffee grounds to AeroPress.
Pour 400g hot water over coffee, ensuring full saturation.
Stir 3 times gently.
Insert plunger and pull slightly up to create vacuum.

notes: Balanced and forgiving recipe suitable for most coffees. Perfect for 2 people. Vacuum step prevents early dripping.

title: Championship Concentrate AeroPress
preparation_steps: Set AeroPress in inverted position with rinsed paper filter ready.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add 100g water rapidly over coffee grounds.
Stir 20 times in 10 seconds.
Flip AeroPress, press through completely.
Dilute concentrate with 120ml additional hot water.

notes: Produces a strong, syrupy concentrate. Ideal for iced coffee or Americanos after dilution.

title: Championship Concentrate AeroPress
preparation_steps: Set AeroPress in inverted position with rinsed paper filter ready.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add 200g water rapidly over coffee grounds.
Stir 20 times in 10 seconds.
Flip AeroPress, press through completely.
Dilute concentrate with 240ml additional hot water.

notes: Produces a strong, syrupy concentrate. Perfect for 2 people. Ideal for iced coffee or Americanos after dilution.

title: Championship Concentrate AeroPress
preparation_steps: Set AeroPress in inverted position with rinsed paper filter ready.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add 300g water rapidly over coffee grounds.
Stir 20 times in 10 seconds.
Flip AeroPress, press through completely.

notes: Produces a strong, syrupy concentrate. Perfect for 3 people. Ideal for iced coffee or Americanos after dilution.

title: Championship Concentrate AeroPress
preparation_steps: Set AeroPress in inverted position with rinsed paper filter ready.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add 400g water rapidly over coffee grounds.

notes: Produces a strong, syrupy concentrate. Perfect for 4 people. Ideal for iced coffee or Americanos after dilution.

title: AeroPress Cold Brew Concentrate
preparation_steps: Add to AeroPress chamber (inverted or upright).

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 500g room temperature water over grounds.
Stir to ensure even saturation.
After 5–10 hours of steeping at room temperature, press through filter.
Refrigerate overnight before serving.

notes: Produces smooth, low-acidity cold brew. Can be served over ice or diluted with water/milk.

title: AeroPress Cold Brew Concentrate
preparation_steps: Add to AeroPress chamber (inverted or upright).

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 1000g room temperature water over grounds.
Stir to ensure even saturation.
After 5–10 hours of steeping at room temperature, press through filter.
Refrigerate overnight before serving.

notes: Produces smooth, low-acidity cold brew. Perfect for 2 people. Can be served over ice or diluted with water/milk.

title: AeroPress Cold Brew Concentrate
preparation_steps: Add to AeroPress chamber (inverted or upright).

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 2000g room temperature water over grounds.
Stir to ensure even saturation.
After 5–10 hours of steeping at room temperature, press through filter.
Refrigerate overnight before serving.

title: AeroPress Espresso-Style Concentrate
preparation_steps: Grind 18–20 grams of coffee fine, similar to espresso.
Set up AeroPress in standard position with rinsed filter.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add coffee grounds to chamber.
Pour 100g hot water over grounds.
Press firmly and consistently for about 30 seconds.

notes: Produces a thick, syrupy concentrate. Excellent for milk drinks like cappuccinos and lattes.

title: AeroPress Espresso-Style Concentrate
preparation_steps: Grind 38 grams of coffee fine, similar to espresso.
Set up AeroPress in standard position with rinsed filter.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add coffee grounds to chamber.
Pour 200g hot water over grounds.
Press firmly and consistently for about 35 seconds.

notes: Produces a thick, syrupy concentrate. Perfect for 2 people. Excellent for milk drinks like cappuccinos and lattes.

title: AeroPress Espresso-Style Concentrate
preparation_steps: Set up AeroPress in standard position with rinsed filter.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add coffee grounds to chamber.

Press firmly and consistently for about 40 seconds.

notes: Produces a thick, syrupy concentrate. Perfect for 3 people. Excellent for milk drinks like cappuccinos and lattes.

title: AeroPress Espresso-Style Concentrate
preparation_steps: Set up AeroPress in standard position with rinsed filter.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add coffee grounds to chamber.

title: French Press Classic
preparation_steps: Grind 30 grams of coffee to coarse consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 500g hot water
Stir gently to saturate grounds
Place lid on top (don't press yet)
Press plunger down slowly
Pour immediately

notes: Simple and forgiving method, produces full-bodied coffee.

title: French Press Classic
preparation_steps: Grind 60 grams of coffee to coarse consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 1000g hot water over grounds
Stir gently to saturate all grounds
Place lid on top (don't press yet)
Wait 3.5 minutes for extraction
Press plunger down slowly and steadily
Pour immediately to prevent over-extraction

notes: Perfect for serving 2 people. Simple and forgiving method that produces full-bodied coffee.

title: French Press Classic
preparation_steps: Grind 90 grams of coffee to coarse consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 1500g hot water over grounds
Stir gently to saturate all grounds
Place lid on top (don't press yet)
Wait 3.75 minutes for extraction
Press plunger down slowly and steadily
Pour immediately to prevent over-extraction

notes: Perfect for serving 3 people. Simple and forgiving method that produces full-bodied coffee.

title: French Press Classic
preparation_steps: Grind 120 grams of coffee to coarse consistency.
Use extra large French Press (2L capacity)

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 2000g hot water over grounds
Stir gently to saturate all grounds
Place lid on top (don't press yet)
Wait 4 minutes for extraction
Press plunger down slowly and steadily
Pour immediately to prevent over-extraction

notes: Perfect for serving 4 people. Simple and forgiving method that produces full-bodied coffee.
